business.headline: ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

Why some IPO stocks keep running for days after listing, explains Nithin KamathIPO stocks continuing to rise after listing may seem puzzling.  Nithin Kamath breaks down a technical reason that is often overlooked by retail investors.

IndiGo chaos: Competition regulator reviews 'antitrust violations' by airlineIndiGo cancelled about 4,500 flights earlier this month due to poor pilot roster planning, stranding tens of thousands of passengers, triggering a major aviation crisis.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as global cues remain weak, IT stocks limit lossesThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 77.84 points to close at 84,481.81, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 3 points to end at 25,815.55.

Tata Electronics gets Rs 1,500 crore boost as Apple manufacturing expands in IndiaThe fresh funding underlines Tata Group's continued support for expanding capacity at Tata Electronics, which has emerged as one of Apple's largest iPhone manufacturing partners in India.

Why hasn't the minimum EPS pension been raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?The government has reiterated financial and actuarial constraints in response to renewed calls for an increase in the minimum EPS-95 pension, but no timeline or policy decision has been announced.
Amazon to lay off 370 staff in Luxembourg. What's driving the job cuts?Amazon employs about 4,370 people in Luxembourg, and the planned cuts will affect nearly 8.5% of its workforce there.

Worst behind us, IndiGo CEO tells staff after days of flight cancellations chaosAfter days of cancellation chaos, IndiGo said it has stabilised operations and restored its network to about 2,200 flights a day. Meanwhile, CEO Pieter Elbers has blamed the disruption on a compounding effect of several factors.

Why Ola Electric's Bhavish Aggarwal is selling stake as shares hit 52-week lowThe immediate reason for the latest fall of Ola Electric has been Bhavish Aggarwal's back‑to‑back selling of the stock in the open market over two days, worth well over Rs 200 crore in total.
Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell 4% to hit 52-week low todayOla Electric share price: The stock hit a low of Rs 31.54 on December 18, marking its weakest level since listing.

55,000% rally in Indian AI stock triggers bubble concerns: ReportA little-known Indian company has delivered a stunning 55,000% rise in just under two years, raising serious questions about hype, regulation and investor risk.
Sensex opens 189 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 87.06 points to 84,472.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 24.30 points to 25,794.25 as of 9:28 am.

entertainment.headline: Niddhi Agerwal shares her first post after Hyderabad mall mobbing incident Actor Niddhi Agerwal has shared her first social media video after a mobbing incident at a Hyderabad mall during promotions for her upcoming film 'The Raja Saab'. Check out the video she shared on social media here.

It's a boy! Bharti Singh gives birth after sudden medical emergency Comedian Bharti Singh gave birth to a baby boy on Friday, December 19, after being taken to the hospital from the set of her television show Laughter Chefs.

Quantum leap, game changer: RGV's defining verdict on Dhurandhar and Aditya Dhar Ram Gopal Varma called Dhurandhar a quantum leap for Indian cinema, praising Aditya Dhar as a game changer. He highlighted Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna and the film's bold craft in a long review of the film.

Dhurandhar: Why Sara Arjun is the Aditya Dhar film's softest yet strongest note Amid Dhurandhar's brutal drama, Sara Arjun's quiet and heartfelt turn stands out. While Bollywood fans have just discovered her, the 20-year-old is a seasoned player, having started out as a child artist.

Four More Shots Please S4 review: The last toast is familiar, flawed but quite funRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 Four More Shots Please Seaosn 4 review: Four More Shots Please returns for its fourth and final season with familiar themes and stylish storytelling. The show offers a heartfelt farewell while revisiting complex issues like identity and relationships.

Mrs Deshpande review: Madhuri Dixit steals the show in psychological thrillerRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 Mrs Deshpande series review: Madhuri Dixit plays a serial killer in Mrs Deshpande, a Hindi adaptation of the French thriller, La Mante. The series explores complex psychological themes while keeping viewers on the edge with a gripping murder mystery.

Lee Kwang-soo to host Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-ah's wedding Actor Lee Kwang Soo will host Kim Woo Bin and Shin Min Ah's wedding at The Shilla Hotel in Seoul this Saturday, with D.O. of EXO unable to attend due to prior commitments.

Christopher Nolan unveils new Odyssey poster, prologue plans revealed The unveiling of a new poster for Christopher Nolan's upcoming film The Odyssey, alongside the announcement of its exclusive IMAX prologue screening before Avatar: Fire and Ash, has generated widespread anticipation among film enthusiasts and on social media.

Dhurandhar box office Day 14: Ranveer film storms towards Rs 800 crore worldwide Ranveer Singh's gangster film Dhurandhar continues to deliver robust earnings, concluding its second week in theatres with a net collection of Rs 460 crore in India and poised to surpass Rs 800 crore globally over the weekend.

Bha Bha Ba box office Day 1: Dileep's film opens to Rs 6.75 crore amid shaky reviews Dileep's Bha Bha Ba opened to a strong Rs 6.75 crore collection on its first day. The film's polarising reviews and Mohanlal's cameo add intrigue to its weekend performance.

Why fantasy K-dramas make more sense than real life right now Fantasy K-dramas blend magic, emotion and meaning, offering comfort, structure and emotional honesty when real life feels chaotic and overwhelming.

Nick Jonas and brothers discover new pre-show hype song and its a Dhurandhar track Nick Jonas and the Jonas Brothers have featured the Bollywood song Shararat from Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar as their pre-show hype track. The film's soundtrack has achieved a significant milestone, with every track entering the Spotify Global Top 200.

SRK shields Suhana and Gauri from crowd at son AbRam's annual day event. Watch Actor Shah Rukh Khan was seen guiding his wife Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana Khan through a crowded scene during their arrival at the annual day function for their son AbRam in Mumbai.

Avengers Doomsday: Chris Evans back as Captain America with a child, teaser shows A teaser attached to screenings of Avatar: Fire and Ash confirms Chris Evans is back as Captain America, now as a father, for Avengers: Doomsday, set to release in December 2026.

Neha Kakkar's Candy Shop does disservice to Indian music by mindlessly aping K-pop At a time when the global music industry is finally paying attention to India, Neha Kakkar's new song, Candy Shop, chooses to imitate K-pop over imagination.

Pete Davidson and Elsie Hewitt welcome baby girl Scottie Rose Elsie Hewitt has announced the birth of her daughter with comedian Pete Davidson. The couple celebrated their first child together, Scottie Rose Hewitt Davidson.

Shilpa Shinde returns as Angoori Bhabi, says Sahi pakde hai. Watch teaser Shilpa Shinde is set to return as Angoori Bhabi in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai 2.0, with the new series airing on &TV from December. The actor reflects on her comeback after nearly a decade.

Tom Cruise, Alejandro G Inarritu collaborate for comedy film Digger. Watch teaser Filmmaker Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu and Tom Cruise are set to collaborate on a new film. Titled 'Digger, the makers announced the news with the poster and teaser.

Cristiano Ronaldo joins Fast & Furious cast, pic from set goes viral Footballer Cristiano Ronaldo has officially become part of the 'Fast and Furious' franchise, joining the cast of 'Fast X: Part 2'. The final chapter is set for release in April 2027.

general news.headline: Delhi pollution discussion goes for a toss as Parliament adjourned indefinitelyA key discussion on the worsening air quality in the Delhi-NCR has gone for a toss as the Winter Session of Parliament was adjourned indefinitely soon after resumption on the final day on Friday.

Hindu man lynched over blasphemy claims as protests sweep Bangladesh  Live UpdatesDipu Chandra Das, a Hindu worker in Bangladesh, was killed by an angry mob who accused him of making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The incident came amid ongoing unrest across the country over Osman Hadi's death.

Millions gasp as central govt keeps away from battle of life and deathFighting pollution in Delhi isn't just Delhi's battle. For that instance, no state can fight pollution in isolation. Sources of pollution are varied and spread across several states. The Centre needs to drive this fight with an EPA-like agency that has teeth. This isn't the best issue to showcase federalism when millions of lives are at risk.

Mob torches 2 newspaper offices as Bangladesh boils after student leader's deathViolence erupted in Dhaka after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi. The attacks on media houses highlight growing unrest and allegations against biased coverage.

PM Modi's ear accessory seen during Oman visit sparks buzz. What is it?As PM Modi arrived in Oman, what sparked curiosity on social media was a small, blingy sort of earring on his left ear. It opened a flood of speculations - was it PM Modi's new style?

Gautam Gambhir is not a coach: Kapil Dev drops a bomb amid mounting pressureWorld Cup-winning India captain Kapil Dev said a modern-day cricket coach functions more as a manager than a traditional coach, defending Gautam Gambhir's role amid criticism and emphasising the importance of player management and confidence.

Do not lose jobs: Immigration experts to H-1B holders amid interview delaysFresh H-1B visa interview delays by the US State Department have left hundreds of Indian professionals stranded abroad. Amid this, immigration attorneys are advising professionals to hold on to their current roles, as the steep $100,000 H-1B fee and a grim job market in the US will make re-entry to the America highly unlikely.

The show offers a heartfelt farewell while revisiting complex issues like identity and relationships.

Bharat Taxi is here, and it is already very different from Uber, Ola, RapidoMake way for the new entrant in India's burgeoning ride-hailing space, the Bharat Taxi. In the coming days, it will take on Uber and Ola, with a unique feature-set and strong support from the Indian government. India Today Tech takes a look.

Siddaramaiah camp hosts dinner meet in Belagavi, Shivakumar downplays huddleDinner politics continued in Karnataka's Belagavi as Minister Satish Jarkiholi hosted a meeting of leaders backing Chief Minister Siddaramaiah. The huddle discussed resisting leadership change amid speculation of a Delhi summons.

Live: Mujibur Rehman's house torched, US Embassy condoles death of Osman HadiBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Protests erupted across Bangladesh after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with thousands converging at Shahbag and accusing authorities of failing to protect him. Demonstrators chanted slogans and waved placards, many of them openly showing anti-India and anti–Sheikh Hasina sentiments. The unrest escalated into violence, with protesters vandalising the offices of Daily Prothom Alo and Daily Star. The Awami League's office in Rajshahi was also reportedly torched. Protests spread beyond the capital, with stone-pelting reported at the Indian Assistant High Commission in Chattogram. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

India can't get enough of persimmon this winter. What's behind the hype?From celebrity diets to viral dessert recipes, this centuries-old fruit has got the internet talking.

No conclusive data to prove AQI-lung disease link: GovernmentThe government informed Parliament that there is no conclusive evidence directly connecting higher air quality index levels to lung diseases, while also highlighting ongoing efforts to address air pollution and related health concerns in India.

Cash-for-query case: Delhi High Court grants relief to Trinamool MP Mahua MoitraIn a major relief to the Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra, the Delhi High Court has set aside the Lokpal order which allowed CBI to file a chargesheet against her in the cash-for-query case.

Maruti Suzuki e Vitara review: Can Maruti Suzuki mobilize India again?Maruti Suzuki is attempting to mobilize India again and this time it is through an electric car. But is the car capable enough? We find out.

The new 'high command' = BJP's jodi number oneTraditionally, the word, high command, is associated with the Congress and the Nehru-Gandhi family. But in a twist in the tale, the contemporary high command has shifted location from Congress to the BJP.

Will Samson return to open in Ahmedabad in Gill's absence?IND vs SA: Sanju Samson's long wait could finally end in Ahmedabad after fog denied him a Lucknow return. With Shubman Gill injured and the series secured, India may finally unleash Samson at the top.

Neha Kakkar's Candy Shop does disservice to Indian music by mindlessly aping K-popAt a time when the global music industry is finally paying attention to India, Neha Kakkar's new song, Candy Shop, chooses to imitate K-pop over imagination.

Sharif Osman Hadi: Anti-India student leader whose death sparked protests in DhakaHadi, 32, was a leader of the student protest group Inqilab Mancha, and was also a candidate in the announced February 12 general elections. He has initiated his election campaign in central Dhaka's Bijoynagar area.

Over 150 flights cancelled as dense fog covers Delhi, reduces visibilityDense fog covered the Delhi-NCR on Friday morning, significantly reducing visibility and leading to mass cancellations, including a few international flights.

sports.headline: Travis Head's Adelaide love story rolls on, hometown hero sinks Bazball's Ashes hopes Travis Head produced another stirring century at his beloved Adelaide Oval, surviving a dropped catch on 99 and sealing a dominant Australian position that pushed England's Ashes hopes to the brink.

Unsold at IPL auction, Devon Conway smashes 226 vs WI in Mount Maunganui After being unsold at the IPL 2026 auction, former Chennai Super Kings opener Devon Conway went on to smash his career-best Test score in the third Test against the West Indies at Mount Maunganui.

More pressure on Shubman Gill? Ishan Kishan smashes 49-ball 101 before selectors Ishan Kishan's SMAT final century has reignited the T20I opening debate. With the World Cup just 50 days away, pressure is mounting on Shubman Gill as fans demand change.

India to pick T20 World Cup 2026 squad on December 20 in Mumbai India is set to pick and reveal their squads for the upcoming home T20I series against New Zealand and the T20 World Cup 2026 squad on December 20 in Mumbai at the BCCI Headquarters.

U19 Asia Cup semi-final Live: Toss delayed due to wet outfield IND vs SL, U19 Asia Cup semi-final Live: The Ayush Mahtre-led India will take on Sri Lanka in this highly anticipated U19 Asia Cup semi-final clash in Dubai, and that holds the chance for India to face either Bangladesh or Pakistan in the final. However, the toss for the clash has been delayed multiple times now after rain, and then wet outfield.

New Zealand cricket chief resigns citing disagreement on T20 future New Zealand Cricket faces a leadership shift after Scott Weenink stepped down as chief executive. Deep divisions over T20 cricket and long-term priorities have triggered a reset at the top.

Portugal needs Cristiano Ronaldo: Bruno Fernandes ahead of FIFA World Cup 2026 Bruno Fernandes has shut down claims that Portugal play better without Cristiano Ronaldo. The midfielder insists Ronaldo's presence still shapes games, even as tactical debates resurface before the 2026 World Cup.

Will Samson return to open in Ahmedabad in Gill's absence? IND vs SA: Sanju Samson's long wait could finally end in Ahmedabad after fog denied him a Lucknow return. With Shubman Gill injured and the series secured, India may finally unleash Samson at the top.

Will India vs SA 5th T20I be played or abandoned? What Ahmedabad AQI tells us India vs South Africa: The 5th and the final T20I match of the IND vs SA series is going to be played in Ahmedabad. As biting cold descends in the country, will this match also be ruled out by fog?

Watch: Ben Stokes jumps in frustration, berates himself after Starc ripper Ashes 3rd Test: England captain Ben Stokes struck a crucial 83 to steer the visitors out of trouble after they slumped to 168 for 8 on Thursday. Stokes was left gutted after being dismissed on 83 by a brilliant delivery from Mitchell Starc on the morning of Day 3.

The last dance of 2025: India chase a perfect finish in 5th T20I IND vs SA 5th T20I preview: India will hope to sign off a challenging home assignment against South Africa on a positive note when the two sides meet in the fifth and final T20 International on Friday. While India cannot lose the series, South Africa have the chance to draw level at 2–2, an outcome that Aiden Markram's side would view as a highly successful end to their tour of India.

How did 'unavailable' Josh Inglis fetch 8.6 cr? PBKS fume after fresh twist to storyIPL franchise Punjab Kings have been left fuming after learning that Josh Inglis might be available to play in the Indian Premier League's 2026 season. PBKS had released the player at only Rs 2.6 core after being told that he was not going to play the IPL due to his wedding.

IPL 2026: Josh Inglis' unprofessional behaviour leaves PBKS owner frustratedPunjab Kings co-owner Ness Wadia criticised Josh Inglis for informing the franchise about his limited availability for IPL 2026 just 45 minutes before the retention deadline, saying the late notice disrupted team planning and raised questions over player professionalism.

Gautam Gambhir is not a coach: Kapil Dev drops a bomb amid mounting pressureWorld Cup-winning India captain Kapil Dev said a modern-day cricket coach functions more as a manager than a traditional coach, defending Gautam Gambhir's role amid criticism and emphasising the importance of player management and confidence.

India A end historic Physical Disability T20 series with win over India SeniorIndia A defeated India Senior in the final match of the Physical Disability T20 series at Wankhede Stadium. The series highlighted growing support and inclusivity for differently abled cricketers in India.

Watch: Ishan Kishan's celebration goes viral after Jharkhand's historic SMAT winJharkhand won their first ever Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy on Thursday, December 18. Ishan Kishan took the trophy in his hand and danced his way into the team huddle as the side celebrated a major milestone in Indian cricket history.

UPCA to refund tickets after India-South Africa T20 abandoned due to fogThe Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) on Thursday announced a full refund of ticket prices for spectators after the fourth T20 International between India and South Africa was abandoned due to dense fog.

Why are IPL auctions not being hosted in India? BCCI top boss reveals reasonThe Indian Premier League auction has been held overseas in back-to-back years. Why are IPL auctions being hosted outside India? Chairman Arun Dhumal explains the key reasons behind the decision.

BWF World Tour Finals: Satwik and Chirag close in on semifinal berth in HangzhouSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won their second consecutive match at the BWF World Tour Finals 2025. Their strong performance puts them in a commanding position for a semi-final berth, but a tough match against Malaysian second seeds awaits on Friday.

SMAT final: Jharkhand win historic title after Ishan Kishan's redemption songSMAT Final: Ishan Kishan's belligerent hundred delivered Jharkhand their first ever Syed Mushtaq Ali title on Thursday, December 18. Kishan completed his redemption run right in front of the selectors, handing his team a 69-run win against Haryana.

Qatar's Lusail Stadium set to host Spain vs Argentina in Finalissima 2026Qatar will host the men's Finalissima 2026 at the iconic Lusail Stadium on March 27, 2026, the Local Organising Committee for Football Events announced on Thursday.

Yuzvendra Chahal diagnosed with dengue, chikungunya, out of cricket action for weeksYuzvendra Chahal has shared a health update after being sidelined with dengue and chikungunya, expressing optimism about his return to cricket. The leg-spinner, out from domestic action since late November, is hoping to return to competitive action, sooner rather than later.

Will Shubman Gill play 5th T20I? India star reaches Ahmedabad amid injury reportsShubman Gill arrived with the Indian team in Ahmedabad on Thursday ahead of the fifth and final T20I against South Africa, despite being under an injury cloud after taking a blow to his toe in the lead-up to the fourth match.

Sourav Ganguly files Rs 50 crore defamation suit over Messi's Kolkata event claimsSourav Ganguly has taken legal action against Uttam Saha, president of the Argentina Fan Club of Kolkata, for allegedly making false and damaging statements about his involvement in the controversial Lionel Messi event at Yuva Bharati Stadium.

Nathan Lyon proud after surpassing childhood hero McGrath's Test wicket tallyAustralian off-spinner Nathan Lyon said he felt both humbled and proud after surpassing childhood hero Glenn McGrath's Test wicket tally during the ongoing Adelaide Test.

Ishan Kishan scripts history, becomes first captain to hit a century in SMAT finalSMAT 2025 final: Ishan Kishan's blistering century lit up the SMAT 2025 final, powering a record stand with Kumar Kushagra and leaving Haryana's bowlers stunned in a high-octane title clash in Pune.

Pakistani kabaddi player faces disciplinary action for representing 'India' teamPakistani international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has come under scrutiny after appearing for a team labelled as India at a private tournament in Bahrain, prompting the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation to call an emergency meeting to consider disciplinary action.

I am an ardent fan. Yet Messi's India spectacle didn't move meMessi's grand visit only underscored the harsh truth: India cheers for icons, not the sport itself, as domestic football crumbles under neglect, stalled leagues, and a system unwilling to reform.

SMAT Live: Jharkhand beat Haryana to clinch maiden titleSyed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final, Haryana vs Jharkhand live score: Ishan Kishan's record 101 helped Jharkhand defeat Haryana by 69 runs in the title clash on Thursday to win their maiden Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy in Pune.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
